Package it.polimi.se2.clupapplication.controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.se2.clupapplication.controllers.UserController
@RestController
@CrossOrigin(origins="*",
             maxAge=3600L)
@RequestMapping("/api/auth")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles the authentication backend of CLup, which is composed by the sign up and login methods.

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> generateToken​(@RequestBody LoginUserDTO loginUserDTO) throws org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException
      This method generates a Json Web Token (JWT), according to the RestFUL paradigm.
      Parameters:
      loginUserDTO - the user credentials (in a JSON Object form)
      Returns:
      the authentication token to be stored on client side.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException - if there are some troubles with the login procedure.

    • saveUser

      @RequestMapping(value="/signup", method=POST) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> saveUser​(@RequestBody UserDTO user)
      This method permits to users to sign up and join the CLup community!
      Parameters:
      user - the JSON representation of user's credentials
      Returns:
      a fresh-new user object.

    • checkLogin

      @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'MANAGER\', \'USER\')") @RequestMapping(value="/checkLogin", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> checkLogin()
      Check if a user is logged in.
      Returns:
      status code 200 if the authentication check is successful.

    • me

      @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'MANAGER\', \'USER\', \'ATTENDANT\')") @GetMapping("/me") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> me()
      Returns:
      all the information about the authenticated user, which is identified through the personal token attached to the request.

    • getMyStore

      @GetMapping("/getMyStore") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ATTENDANT\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getMyStore()
      Returns:
      the store in which the attendant that made the request works.
